snippet: Car and truck sales rose 10 percent despite Hurricane Sandy, which washed out three days of business on the East Coast.
abstract: Car and truck sales in United States rise 6.9 percent to about 1.09 million vehicles in October despite Hurricane Sandy, which washed out three days of business on East Coast; sales gained 14.5 percent over the first nine months of year; sales at General Motors rose 4.7 percent during October to 195,000 vehicles; Ford Motor Company and Chrysler report mixed results.

byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic reported from Detroit. Andrew Martin contributed reporting from Montclair, N.J., andMary M. Chapman contributed from Detroit.

lead_paragraph: Car and truck sales rose 10 percent despite Hurricane Sandy, which washed out three days of business on the East Coast.

headline.seo: Car and Truck Sales Failed to Keep Pace in October
headline.main: Car Dealer Sales Failed to Keep Pace in October
headline.print_headline: Car Dealer Sales Failed To Keep Pace in October
